intro: Libanotis laoshanensis, commonly known as the Lao Mountain bellflower, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous regions, preferring well-drained soils. It has hairy leaves and stems, which help it adapt to its harsh environment. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
